manify.embedders.losses

Implementation of different measurement metrics

Functions

Average distance error D_av :type D_est: Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_points'] :param D_est: A tensor of estimated pairwise distances.

Compute the variance in pairwise distances explained by each manifold component.

Compute the distortion loss between estimated SQUARED distances and true SQUARED distances.

Mean averae precision (mAP) from the Gu et al paper.
manify.embedders.losses.d_avg(D_est, D_true, pairwise=False)

Average distance error D_av :type D_est: Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_points'] :param D_est: A tensor of estimated pairwise distances. :type D_est: n_points, n_points :type D_true: Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_points'] :param D_true: A tensor of true pairwise distances. :type D_true: n_points, n_points :type pairwise: bool :param pairwise: A boolean indicating whether to return whether D_est and D_true are pairwise :type pairwise: bool

Returns:

A float indicating the average distance error D_avg, calculated as the mean relative error across all pairwise distances.

Return type:

float

manify.embedders.losses.dist_component_by_manifold(pm, x_embed)

Compute the variance in pairwise distances explained by each manifold component.

Parameters:

  • pm (ProductManifold) – The product manifold.

  • x_embed (n_points, n_dim) – A tensor of embeddings.

Returns:

A list of proportions, where each value represents the fraction

of total distance variance explained by the corresponding manifold component.

Return type:

List[float]

manify.embedders.losses.distortion_loss(D_est, D_true, pairwise=False)

Compute the distortion loss between estimated SQUARED distances and true SQUARED distances. :type D_est: Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_points'] :param D_est: A tensor of estimated pairwise distances. :type D_est: n_points, n_points :type D_true: Float[Tensor, 'n_points n_points'] :param D_true: A tensor of true pairwise distances. :type D_true: n_points, n_points :type pairwise: bool :param pairwise: A boolean indicating whether to return whether D_est and D_true are pairwise :type pairwise: bool

Returns:

A float indicating the distortion loss, calculated as the sum of the squared relative

errors between the estimated and true squared distances.

Return type:

float

See also: square_loss in HazyResearch hyperbolics repo: https://github.com/HazyResearch/hyperbolics/blob/master/pytorch/hyperbolic_models.py#L178

manify.embedders.losses.mean_average_precision(x_embed, graph)

Mean averae precision (mAP) from the Gu et al paper.

Return type:

Float[Tensor, '']
